pullRequest.title: [java] Add supertype for "list nodes"
pullRequest.bodyText:
This adds a common supertype for nodes that act as a kind of list (eg ResourceList, FormalParameters, ThrowsList, etc). This is just a QOL improvement, which makes the API more consistent and complete.
It also solves the problem of whether to expose a List<xxx> or a @Nullable ASTxxxList on  nodes. This is explained in the javadocs of ASTList.
Note, that there are two outliers:

ASTFormalParameters, which excludes the receiver parameter. This is well documented though
ASTModifierList, which doesn't extend the class, because modifiers are in fact not nodes. It could serve as an ASTList<ASTAnnotation>, but I don't really see the point

TODO on master

 Deprecate ASTArgumentsList::getArgumentCount, ASTFormalParameters::getParameterCount, introduce just a size method instead. It's unclear how using more precise method names benefits the API, and this makes it impossible to abstract. See 80cba02

commit.message: Add common supertype for all list nodes

nodes.bodyText: It seems, at some point, we merged ASTArguments + ASTArgumentList. I'll deprecate on master ASTArguments::getArgumentCount() and add a size() method on ASTArgumentList.
